I already made a post on the same thing, but I vote anyway.

I suggest using fewer slots for items for balance, unlike the usual hopper. It can be 3 slots instead of the usual 5.
I'm also thinking of making a function if copper is oxidized, then the transfer of items slows down. It is possible to stop oxidation as well as an ordinary block of copper.
Sounds a bit OP considering regular hoppers are decently fast
Nice idea, but there's little chance of it happening, but I voted for your idea anyway!

I saw one mod where the sniffy gets covered in snow when digging in snow. That would be a fun addition.
There could also be different color sniffer eggs, and depending on the color it would be a different sniffer, and whatever flower color its using it would sniff up more of that flower.

Ack, I know it's not the same thing -- but they could probably name it "moon rose" and make it look sparkly.

I get this idea from Fran Bow (a horror game) has a blue rose called "moonlight rose" and if I remember correctly, it was magical.

I think it'd be really pretty!
"Ground" is a good name. But the game needs opponents who control lightning, in addition to players with a trident.
great idea!
Honestly Archeology would feel incomplete if they didn't add this feature
I think a neat way would be to craft table with 4 sands/gravel around an object in the center to hide, though I'm not sure if the table can handle that function.
That's a great idea, I can imagine using this to hide valuables out in a desert.

si bien el poder crear nuestra propia grava/arena sospecho seria una buena implementación no seria lo mejor ya que por ejemplo: escondes tu objeto mas valioso en grava/arena sospechosa en un server anotas las coordenadas y te vas un jugador ocasional podría estar buscando los nuevos diseños de armadura y justo ve el bloque que colocaste lo escarba y encuentra lo que escondiste y se lo lleva luego tu vuelves lo buscas pero te das cuenta de que no esta. eso podría armar muchos problemas en el servidor como baneos o incluso expulsiones permanentes, no digo que esto no deba ser incluido solo que de tenerse algún tipo de restricción

Just a gravel/sand + any item in a crafting grid should work!

it should be easy so people can hide something quickly!

imagine being chased, and quickly hiding your gear in a few blocks of sand so it wont get stolen as easily

Simple and cool idea! Maybe the trim could look kind of like icicles?
A blizzard armor trim sounds nice.
Like armor trim, but as a decoration on weapons? I'm so down for that because an entire set of decorated tools would be gorgeous!

I don’t really think players actually really use the smithing table. It would add a little bit of interest to the table itself, but for me I don’t really care all that much about achievements.

with this wood be good achievement "Trimt up" for having ful armor trimt with any trim akcept netherite upgrade
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/4404967586189-Expand-the-topic-of-armor
Lectern.
or a common occurrence, so that the mobs look really diverse
Disagree. It is only something players are able to do.

I recommend that mobs that spawn with armor trims would have to be limited to one armor trim per mob and they have to spawn in hard difficulty. Armor trims are meant to be valuable and should be kept as such; this makes sure they're not too easy to obtain.

I think it would be cool to have certain mobs could have a chance to spawn with different armor trims.

For example:

Piglins and piglin brutes could have a chance to spawn with the snout armor trim

Drowned could have a chance to spawn with coast armor trim

Husks could have a chance to spawn with the dune armor trim

Wither skeletons could have a chance to spawn with the rib armor trim

 

Also it would be cool if there was a verry rare chance for piglin bruits to spawn with a nethorite armor with nethorite armor with gold snout trim to help hint that the nethorite upgrades are found in bastions.

I was thinking the same thing. I think instead of a “rare” occurrence only it should be in the general location of where the trim can spawn. Ex. Mobs in ancient cities can spawn with silent trimmed gear on. For smaller structures or effectively biome specific structures like desert temples and wells the mobs in the entire biome should be able to spawn one if there is a structure that spawned in the biome.
Nah man. I think that they should add some new redstone stuff.
It should be an ancient fantasy plant.
Maybe it should be an ancient version of the tomato seeds, so it will be bigger than the typical Tomato, and the same logic could apply to other plants as well.
